title: internal compiler error: unexpected panic with anonymous lifetimes

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I tried this code:

**main.rs**
```rust
pub struct Db<'a> {
    z: &'a str,
}

impl<'_> Drop for Db<'_> {
    fn drop(&mut self) {}
}

fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
```

**cargo.toml**
```toml
cargo-features = ["edition"]

[package]
name = "bug"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2018"

[dependencies]
```

I expected to see this happen: code compiled or error shown.

Instead, this happened: compiler panic

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.30.0-nightly (1c2e17f4e 2018-09-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 1c2e17f4e3a2070a7f703f51e29c1c388ef703b6
commit-date: 2018-09-04
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.30.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0
```

Backtrace:

```
cargo build
   Compiling bug v0.1.0 (file:///C:/code/bug)
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: self.is_collecting_in_band_lifetimes', librustc\hir\lowering.rs:746:9
stack backtrace:
   0: <std::sys::windows::args::Args as core::ops::drop::Drop>::drop
   1: <std::sys::windows::dynamic_lib::DynamicLibrary as core::ops::drop::Drop>::drop
   2: std::panicking::take_hook
   3: std::panicking::take_hook
   4: <rustc::ty::sty::Binder<rustc::ty::ProjectionPredicate<'tcx>> as rustc::ty::ToPredicate<'tcx>>::to_predicate
   5: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
   6: <rustc::ty::AdtDef as core::cmp::PartialOrd>::partial_cmp
   7: <rustc::hir::lowering::LoweringContext::lower_async_fn_ret_ty::AsyncFnLifetimeCollector<'r, 'a> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'v>>::visit_lifetime
   8: rustc::ty::context::TypeckTables::expr_ty
   9: rustc::middle::lang_items::LanguageItems::items
  10: <rustc::hir::lowering::LoweringContext::lower_async_fn_ret_ty::AsyncFnLifetimeCollector<'r, 'a> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'v>>::visit_lifetime
  11: rustc::hir::lowering::LoweringContext::lower_item
  12: <rustc::hir::lowering::LoweringContext::lower_crate::ItemLowerer<'lcx, 'interner> as syntax::visit::Visitor<'lcx>>::visit_item
  13: rustc::hir::lowering::lower_crate
  14: rustc_driver::target_features::add_configuration
  15: rustc_driver::driver::count_nodes
  16: rustc_driver::driver::compile_input
  17: rustc_driver::run_compiler
  18: rustc_driver::driver::build_output_filenames
  19: rustc_driver::run_compiler
  20: <termcolor::Buffer as std::io::Write>::flush
  21: _rust_maybe_catch_panic
  22: termcolor::ParseColorError::invalid
  23: rustc_driver::main
  24: <unknown>
  25: std::panicking::update_panic_count
  26: _rust_maybe_catch_panic
  27: std::rt::lang_start_internal
  28: <unknown>
  29: <unknown>
  30: BaseThreadInitThunk
  31: RtlUserThreadStart
query stack during panic:
end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.30.0-nightly (1c2e17f4e 2018-09-04) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `bug`.
```
